text: Pope Urban VIII (; 5 April 1568 â€“ 29 July 1644), born Maffeo Barberini, was an Italian cleric of the Roman Catholic Church and the 236th Pope from 1623 to 1644. "List of Popes," Catholic Encyclopedia (2009); retrieved 2011-11-15. == Early life == Maffeo Barberini was born in 1568 into the Barberini family of Florence in Italy. His studies led to a doctorate of law from the University of Pisa in 1589."Pope Urban VIII," Catholic Encyclopedia; retrieved 2011-11-15. ==Bishop== In 1604, Pope Clement VIII appointed Barberini Archbishop of Nazareth. He was transferred by Pope Paul V who made him the Bishop of Spoleto in 1608. ==Cardinal== In 1606, Paul V raising Barberini to be Cardinal of S. Pietro in Montorio. ==Pope== Cardinal Barberini was elected pope on August 6, 1623; and took the name Urban VIII. Pope Urban was involved in Italian and European political disputes. During his reign, the papal palace at Castel Gandolfo was built.Society for the Diffusion of Useful Knowledge. (1843). "Urban IV," Penny cyclopaedia, Vol. 26, p. 46. Pope Urban caused the baldachin to be built over the central altar in St. Peter's Basilica. ==Related pages == * List of popes * List of popes by length of reign ==References== ==Other websites== * * Catholic Hierarchy, Pope Urban VIII * GCatholic, Pope Urban VIII * Cardinals of the Holy Roman Church , Cardinal Barberini Category:Italian popes Category:People from Florence Category:1568 births Category:1644 deaths
title: Pope Urban VIII
